ext_descriptions.ext_description: An Aggregate_connectivity_requirement is the association between a set of one or more and one that ensures that the requirement for connectivity is maintained between the functional and the physical designs.
the design_definition_path specifies the role of the for the Aggregate_connectivity_requirement.
the connectivity_requirement specifies the role of the for the Aggregate_connectivity_requirement.

A Connectivity_allocation is the relationship between a functional connectivity requirement and its implementation. The collection of functional terminals in the functional decomposition that are connected is allocated to one equivalent physical node. That equivalent physical node is an implementation in the Connectivity_allocation.
This part of ISO 10303 supports the capability to specify the paths through the functional decomposition that are reachable via terminals associated with given nodes. This is a statement of transitive closure for connectivity across the decomposition. This part of ISO 10303 does not separately represent a fully resolved functional node.

the connectivity_requirement specifies the role of the for the Connectivity_allocation.
The connectivity_requirement effectively specifies one equivalent functional node.
the implementation specifies the role of the for the Connectivity_allocation.
